result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Yusuf Elijah Patterson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Yusuf Elijah Patterson in court.  Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey in court for Yusuf Elijah Patterson.  Prosecuting attorney Grace M. Gall appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests an additional status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing (21 pages) commencing 06-14-2022 by Katherine M. Nelson.

Defendant Yusuf Elijah Patterson in court.  Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey in court for Yusuf Elijah Patterson.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date. Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Speedy Trial.  (Yusef E. Patterson, House of Correction - L6/32, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction.  (Yusef E. Patterson, House of Correction - L6/32, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Speedy Trial.  (Yusuf Patterson, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Statement.  (Yusuf Patterson, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Defendant Yusuf Elijah Patterson, appear by video in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey, appear by video.  Defendant Yusuf Elijah Patterson in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took Judical Notice to case 21CF3390. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer R. Klarkowski.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Attorney Meera Al-Henaey
Received and Filed:  Proposed No Contact/No Firearms Order.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  No driving at all while case is pending.

Defendant Yusuf Elijah Patterson in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Defendant Yusuf Elijah Patterson in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Yusuf Elijah Patterson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Motion to dismiss by the defense, argued and DENIED by the Court. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
